result.execSummary:
The defendant Christine M. RODRIGUEZ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no assaultive or abusive contact with the victim, Charles Krummel.

Continue with counseling presently enrolled in. 

Take medications as prescribed and in prescribed doses.

Provide DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christine M. RODRIGUEZ

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: All records scanned and verified.

The Court hereby orders that the judgment of conviction be modified as follows.  The condition of probation reading "have no contact with the victim, Charles Krummel", shall now read "have no assaultive or abusive contact with the victim, Charles Krummel".
Copy to DOC.
Judgment of Conviction Sentence to Jail.  Duplicate original delivered to Sheriff.
Judgment of Conviction Sentence Withheld, Probation Ordered.  Duplicate original delivered to DOC.
Associated with Charge #1
Sentencing hearing is reset to 02-11-15 at 2:30 p.m.
Copy delivered to DOC

ADDRESS INFO for Christine M. RODRIGUEZ
Current: 107 N. 6th Street, Reedsville, WI 54230 United States  (Effective: 11-05-2014)
Prior: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States

Defendant in custody.  
State files an Amended Information charging 1 ct. First Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, contrary to Section 941.30(1) of the Wisconsin Statutes and 1 ct. Criminal Damage to Property, contrary to Section 943.01(1) of the Wisconsin Statutes.  No contest pleas to the charges.  Convicted.  Court orders a pre-sentence investigation report to be completed by DOC.  Sentencing hearing set for 02-006-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Report due by 01-28-15.  
Counsel have a joint recommendation to amend defendant's bond from cash to recognizance bond with the same conditions including an additional one that she reside with her mother, Sandra Fischer, 107 N. 6th Street, Reedsville, WI  54320.  Court will grant the request to modify defendant's bond with the previous conditions and adding one that she reside with her mother and also take her medications as prescribed to her.  
$20,000.00 recognizance bond furnished and defendant is released from custody.  
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights. 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Plea Date scheduled for 11-05-2014 @ 11:00 a.m. BR-1.

Plea Date scheduled for 10-21-2014 @ 10:30 a.m. BR-1.
Rescheduled from 10-17-2014.

Defendant in custody.   
Counsel argue bail modification.  Court finds the setting of some cash bail is appropriate, but will reduce it to $10,000.00 cash, continuing any previous conditions and adding the condition that defendant, upon release, must reside with her mother at 107 N. 6th Street, Reedsville, WI  54320.  
Amended Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail   
Minutes.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 09-04-14 at 4:00 p.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.
Motion hearing set for 08-11-14 at 8:30 a.m.

Notice of Motion; Motion for Bail Reduction.  
Motion hearing set for 08-11-14 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives her statutory time limits within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 08-06-14 at 1:30 p.m.
Minutes.
Ann Larson, public defender.
RE:  Charles Krummel, on 07-08-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of attempted 1st degree intentional homicide and criminal damage to property.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 07-21-14 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $20,000.00 cash with the conditions that she have no contact with Charles Krummel or his residence at 1003 19th Street, Two Rivers, WI and that she not possess any dangerous weapons. Cash bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.

Subpoena issued for patient records from Aurora Medical Center, Two Rivers, WI. Re: patient records for Christine Rodriguez, DOB: 03-28-1964 from 07-08-14 through 07-12-14.
Affidavit of Detective Sgt. Peter McGinty, Two Rivers Police Department.
Affidavit of Detective Sgt. Peter McGinty, Two Rivers Police Department.
Search warrant issued.  RE:  DNA of Christine Rodriguez, DOB: 03-28-1964.
